name: Vanilla JS
more: My very FIRST time building something using pure Javascript. I was surprised that I was able to pick up learning this relatively 'fast.' The interface may be aesthethically simple, but it works perfectly as intended. This was a homework assignment to build a multiple choice coding quiz that keeps track of user score time and correct answers.

name: Mobile-First Responsive Design with 2 API calls
more: This was a GROUP project with four contributors. My primary role was to style a responsive page using bootstrap, a CSS framework. It works as a single-page application with auto-scroll and parallex effect.

name: Vanilla JS with API calls
more: Second build with Vanilla Javascript: I used Day.js as a third party API to build a scheduling interface. Past, present, future times are color coded. The time slots can input text and saves information to localStorage. This allows the rendering/ displaying of all saved content upon page refresh.

name: jQuery with API calls
more: Using a Weather API, writing with jQuery made it easier to retrieve external JSON data and append it accordingly on the page. The search button works and will display weather information for a particular city as well as saving the search history on the page. The search history is 'clickable' and will display the appropriate result.
